intro: Swartzia versicolor, commonly known as the variable swartzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Swartzia versicolor typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
